title: 524 - Just How Far Did Students Fall Behind During COVID-19?
itunes:title: 524 - Just How Far Did Students Fall Behind During COVID-19?
description: Pandemic disruptions led to serious learning loss in K-12 education, and new research shows just how serious. Peggy Carr, the commissioner of the National Center for Education Statistics, talks with Stephanie Desmon about what the data shows in terms of student performance, why these historic declines will have impacts for years to come, and what can be done to start closing the gaps.
